contentrichtext.text: {{dablink|For other uses of the name, see [[Zane (disambiguation)|Zane]].}} The '''Zane family''' was important to the early history and settlement of the [[U.S. state]] of [[Ohio]]. The brothers [[Ebenezer Zane|Ebenezer]] (1747–1811) and Isaac Zane laid out sections of the [[Ohio Territory]], including the municipalities of [[Zanesville, Ohio|Zanesville]] and [[Zanesfield, Ohio|Zanesfield]]. Their sister was [[Betty Zane]] (1759–1823), heroine of the Revolutionary War. * [[Isaac Zane]] (1753–1816) was kidnapped at age nine as a child by [[Wyandot people|Wyandot]] Indians about 1762 from his family home near Moorefield, Virginia. He was adopted into the tribe and lived with them for 17 years. He married ''Myerrah'' (“White Crane”), the daughter of Chief [[Tarhe]], so had a prominent position within the tribe.<ref>[http://www.wyandot.org/tarhe.htm Thelma Marsh, "Tarhe"], Wyandot Nation of Kansas Website</ref> * Hannah Zane, mother of Elizabeth Burton Zane. * Elizabeth Burton (Zane) Conley (1838–1879), Isaac's granddaughter, was a multi-racial member of the Wyandots and mother of the [[Lyda Conley|Conley sisters]], born in Logan County, OH. They saved the [[Wyandot National Burying Ground]] in [[Kansas City, Missouri|Kansas City]].<ref>[http://www.wyandot.org/tarhe.htm "Burials at Huron Indian Cemetery"], Wyandot Nation of Kansas</ref> * [[Zane Grey]] (1872–1939), a popular author of [[Western (genre)|Western]] novels, was the latest notable figure of the family. Grey's mother was a Zane descendant. She named him Zane in honor of this maternal line. Other places named for the family include: * [[Zane Township, Logan County, Ohio]] * [[Zane's Trace]], an early road running through Ohio from [[Wheeling, West Virginia]] to [[Maysville, Kentucky]]. == Sources == <references/> {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Family, Zane | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Family, Zane}} [[Category:American families]] [[Category:History of Ohio]] [[Category:Native American history of Ohio]] {{Ohio-bio-stub}}
